case_vignette: A 4-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of a generalized rash for 3 days. During this period, he has had severe itching and was not able to sleep well. He has also had fever, headache, and some muscle pain. Five days ago, he had a runny nose which subsided with over-the-counter medications. He returned from a camping trip 1 week ago. He attends a daycare center. The patient is at the 55th percentile for height and at the 50th percentile for weight. His temperature is 38.2°C (100.7°F), pulse is 97/min, and blood pressure is 96/60 mm Hg. Examination of the skin shows several macules, papules, and crusted lesions over his face, trunk, and extremities. There are a few fluid-filled vesicles over his abdomen and back. There is no cervical lymphadenopathy. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've got a rash all over my body, it's been itching a lot, and I haven't been sleeping well because of it.
Have you had any fever or chills?
Yes, I've had a fever.
Have you had any recent travel or exposure to any new animals or insects?
I went camping about a week ago.
Have you been taking any medications recently?
I took some over-the-counter medicine for my runny nose a few days ago.
Have you had any recent changes in your appetite or weight?
No, there haven't been any changes in my appetite or weight.
Have you had any recent changes in your energy levels or mood?
I've been having a hard time sleeping because of the itching.
Have you had any recent changes in your skin color or texture?
My skin has a rash with spots, bumps and some crusty areas, and I also have a few blisters on my belly and back.
Final Diagnosis: Chickenpox.
